options.systemMessage:
=### System Prompt
You are an AI agent that connects job postings with skill statistics.  
You have two main sources: **Supabase (job descriptions)** and **Airtable (skills & counts)**.  
Always **use the Think Tool first** before answering.  
- For job insights: search Supabase for job descriptions and extract technical terms.  
- For skill trends: query Airtable to get skill names and counts.  
- For combined analysis: match skills from Airtable with requirements in Supabase jobs.  
- Use the Calculator Tool for percentages, averages, or comparisons.  
Stay strict to these sources and never invent data outside them.  

---

### Tools You Have Access To

1. **Think Tool**  
   - Purpose: Force yourself to pause and reason before answering.  
   - Always use this tool first to make sure your output is logical and based on the data.  

2. **Supabase Vector Store Get Jobs**  
   - Purpose: Search job descriptions stored in the Supabase database.  
   - Each job is stored as a vector embedding, so you can do semantic search.  
   - Use this tool when you need to analyze customer requirements, extract technical terms, or compare multiple jobs.  

3. **Airtable Get Top Skills**  
   - Purpose: Retrieve skills and skill counts.  
   - This is your source for seeing which skills are most demanded overall.  
   - Use this tool when you are asked about trending skills or need to cross-check job requirements against skill popularity.  

4. **Calculator Tool**  
   - Purpose: Perform math operations like percentages, averages, or totals.  
   - Use this when analyzing skill counts, salary ranges, or statistics.

parameters.toolDescription: Retrieves job posting descriptions from Supabase vector store using semantic search, with reranking for relevance.

parameters.content: ## Merge Records From Multiple Database Columns

parameters.text:
=Read this job posting description and extract information.

CRITICAL: Your response must be ONLY a valid JSON object. Nothing else.
NO explanations, NO markdown, NO text before or after.

Tasks:
1. Write a summary of customer needs in first-person voice (Senior n8n developer wanted for...)
2. Extract technical skills: languages, frameworks, tools, platforms, databases, APIs, cloud services, DevOps tools

Required JSON format (copy exactly):
{
  "description_summary": "summary text here",
  "description_skills": ["skill1", "skill2", "skill3"]
}

Job posting: {{ $json.description }}

messageValues.message:
=You are an AI agent that reads job postings and extracts both:
1. A complete description summary of all customer needs/requirements.
2. Technical terms required to do the work.

Technical terms include but are not limited to:
Programming languages (Python, TypeScript, Java)
Frameworks & libraries (LangChain, React, PyTorch)
Agent/orchestrators (n8n, MCP, Airflow)
Models & LLMs (GPT-4, Llama-3, Claude)
Cloud & services (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Databases & vector stores (PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Pinecone)
APIs & protocols (REST, GraphQL, Webhooks)
DevOps/CLI/tools (Docker, Git, Bash, Kubernetes)
Data/ML tools (Pandas, TensorFlow, scikit-learn)

Your tasks:
- Write a description summary that keeps customer requirements intact.
- Find exact technical terms written in the job posting.
- Infer terms if they are strongly implied (mark as inferred).
- Keep technical terms separate from non-tool skills (like teamwork).
- STRICTLY output ONLY the JSON object exactly in this format:

{
	"description_summary": "Full summary of customer needs and requirements.",
	"description_skills": ["Python","n8n","Airtable"]
}

data.title: N8N | Complaint Management Automation with AI Agents
data.description:
Hello,

I’m looking for a developer to build an automated complaint handling system using n8n.
This is a well-paid project — I’ve budgeted around $1000, but it can be lower (≈$800) or higher (≈$1500) depending on the final agreement with my client.

Project Scope – Phase 1

Read incoming complaint emails (Lotus/Domino mailbox)

Create a ticket in ClickUp with all details

Detect missing information → email the customer to request details

Suggest a default complaint reason code

Register the complaint in JD Edwards (via API) with status 999

Send confirmation email to the customer with complaint number

Update ClickUp ticket status → “Ready for consideration” or “Awaiting customer response”

Requirements

Must be implemented with n8n

Clear documentation: setup, workflow diagrams, credentials, admin guide

At least 14 days of post-go-live support (monitoring, bug fixes, tweaks)

Start: Wednesday, Sep 17, 2025

Delivery: within 5 days

Tech Stack

n8n (Docker, self-hosted)

Google Cloud (Cloud Run/Functions, Pub/Sub, Vertex AI for later phases)

Python for parsing and business logic

API Integrations: Lotus, ClickUp, JD Edwards

Important

⚠️ Only serious applicants

Please include a Loom video (or similar screen recording) others will get ignored. 

Introduce yourself politely

Explain your approach to building this workflow

Show that you have experience with n8n and API integrations

No generic or copy-paste proposals — we are looking for professionals only

data.title: Expert n8n Automation & AI Agents Specialist
data.description:
We are a specialized agency that builds advanced automation and AI solutions for businesses. We transform our clients' operations by creating intelligent workflows, custom AI Agents, and seamless system integrations. Our services range from AI-powered lead qualification and customer support to streamlining complex internal processes.

We are looking for a top-tier n8n expert to be our lead technical implementer, a true master of the platform who can turn strategic plans into powerful, reliable, and sophisticated automated workflows.

The Role:

As our n8n Automation & AI Integration Specialist, you will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the core automation solutions we provide to our clients. You will handle a diverse range of projects, requiring both creativity and deep technical expertise in the n8n ecosystem. This is a hands-on role where you will directly build the automations that drive significant value for our clients.

Key Responsibilities:

Develop Advanced AI Agent Workflows: Build the n8n backbone for our custom AI Agents, including lead qualification bots on popular business messaging platforms, AI-driven customer support agents, and complex multi-agent systems for operational tasks (e.g., document and image analysis).

Lead Management & CRM Automation: Architect and implement robust workflows for capturing leads from all sources (website forms, Facebook Lead Ads, etc.), cleaning and validating data, and seamlessly integrating with client CRMs and Google Sheets.

Build Sophisticated Business Messaging Automations: Create intelligent communication flows on leading mobile messaging apps, such as automated appointment reminders from Google Calendar, scheduled broadcasts, and interactive customer journeys.

Marketing & Reputation Automation: Construct smart funnels for generating Google reviews, develop Instagram auto-responders, and build systems to monitor social media platforms for new business opportunities.

Internal Process and System Integration: Design and implement automations to sync data between various platforms, including CRMs, accounting/ERP systems (like Priority), project management tools (like Monday.com), and cloud storage.

Custom Technical Solutions: Tackle unique and complex client challenges by leveraging the full power of n8n, including working with custom APIs, webhooks, and data transformation to create bespoke solutions.

Troubleshooting and Optimization: Ensure all automations are robust, efficient, and include proper error handling.

What We're Looking For:

Proven mastery of n8n: You are an expert with a deep understanding of n8n's architecture, including its full range of nodes, error handling, branching logic, and best practices for building scalable workflows. A strong portfolio of complex n8n projects is essential.

Exceptional API & Webhook Skills: Extensive experience integrating a wide variety of third-party services via REST APIs (using OAuth2, API Keys, etc.) and processing incoming webhook data.

Strong Problem-Solving Mindset: The ability to analyze a client's business process, identify key challenges, and architect an elegant and effective automated solution.

Broad Integration Experience: Familiarity with connecting to and automating platforms such as:

Communication: APIs for major business messaging platforms, Email/SMTP.

Productivity: Google Workspace (Sheets, Calendar, Drive), Monday.com.

Marketing: Facebook & Instagram APIs.

CRM & ERP systems.

Autonomy and Reliability: The ability to take ownership of a project from the initial brief to final delivery with high attention to detail.

data.title: Job Post: Figma Designer Needed — Brand System + Scalable Templates
data.description:
Job Post: Figma Designer Needed — Brand System + Scalable Templates

About Us
Caldor Solutions helps boutique consulting firms (1–20 employees) scale sustainably. We’ve built an AI-powered Growth Engine that delivers predictable client acquisition and positions us for a broader Virtual Operations vision.

We already have:

Logo (cyan #44CCCC + black).

Core font (Nourd in Canva).

Clear brand voice guide (authoritative, contrarian, human-centered AI).

Now we need a designer to turn this into a polished, modular brand system in Figma with templates we can use internally and adapt for clients.

Scope of Work

Brand Kit (Core System)

Expand color palette (primary, neutrals, accents, usage ratios).

Define typography hierarchy (Nourd as core, plus fallback font for MS Word/Docs).

Logo usage rules.

Image/illustration direction (abstract AI + human).

Template Library (Figma → Canva ready if needed)

LinkedIn posts (carousel, quote card, client spotlight).

Newsletter layout.

YouTube thumbnail template.

Presentation slide deck template.

One-pager / lead magnet.

Client Plug-In Kit

Simple way to swap logos/colors per client without breaking consistency.

Provide a short usage guide so our VA (non-designer) can apply it.

Handoff Deliverables

1–2 page Brand Guide PDF (colors, fonts, ratios, tone).

All files editable in Figma (exportable to Canva if needed).

Requirements

Proven experience creating brand systems in Figma (not just static designs).

Strong eye for modern, professional B2B/SaaS-style design.

Ability to make assets easy for non-designers to use.

Portfolio showing branding + template systems.

Nice-to-Have:

Canva familiarity (for team handoff).

Understanding of automation (n8n, Zapier, APIs).

Budget
$750–$1,500 depending on experience and scope.
We’re looking for a mid-level designer: professional polish and system thinking, without the agency overhead.

Connect APIs (Claude, GPT-4/5, Google Docs, Slack, Shopify, etc.).

Deliverables:

How to Apply:

Share relevant workflow diagrams or repos.

Tell us how you’d approach building the swipe file → rewrite → Google Doc pipeline.

data.title: Facebook Insights Automation Expert Needed
data.description:
Brief: n8n Automation Developer for Facebook Insights

We are looking for a skilled n8n automation developer to improve and expand our existing automation for Facebook Insights. This role requires strong experience with API integrations, data transformation, and analytics. You will work directly with the Meta Marketing API and help us generate meaningful insights that can be visualised in Google Sheets or a reporting platform such as Looker Studio.

If you have experience automating marketing data pipelines, enjoy optimising data flows, and are familiar with Meta’s ecosystem, we would love to hear from you.

Scope of Work

The final product must:

Pull Data

Extract campaign, ad set, and ad level data from our Facebook App via the Marketing API.

Use multiple Meta API edges, objects, and parameters to ensure comprehensive coverage of performance data.

Process Data

Ingest, wrangle, and clean the data.

Normalise naming conventions and structures across campaigns, ad sets, and ads.

Ensure accuracy and avoid duplication.

Output Data

Send processed data into Google Sheets.

Provide flexibility to connect with visualisation tools such as Looker Studio or others (we are open to your recommendations on the best reporting approach).

Improve Existing Automation

We already have an n8n automation set up.

The task is to refine, optimise, and expand it for better efficiency and richer insights.

Key Questions and Insights Required

We want to be able to answer the following:

Performance Tracking

How is each campaign performing?

Metrics: impressions, click-through rate (CTR), cost per click (CPC), cost per mille (CPM), frequency, results, cost per result, engagement (likes, shares, comments).

Creative Testing

Which creative elements drive the best results?

Compare performance of multiple images, videos, headlines, descriptions, and primary text variations against selected metrics (for example, CTR, results).

Audience and Placement Analysis

Which placements perform best?

Which audiences convert or click most?

Which platforms and demographics drive engagement or results?

Additional Considerations

The solution should be scalable, allowing us to easily add new campaigns, ad sets, or ads without major rework.

Automation should include error handling (for example, failed API calls, missing data).

A clear data schema or documentation of fields pulled, how they are transformed, and where they are stored.

Optional: the ability to schedule pulls (for example, daily or weekly refresh).

data.title: Supabase and N8n Configuration Specialist Needed for Multiple Clients
data.description:
📝 Job Description for Upwork

Title:
Supabase + n8n Setup for Multi-Client Automated Workflow

Project Description:
I’m looking for an experienced freelancer in n8n and Supabase to set up a scalable system that allows me to manage multiple clients efficiently.

The goal is to have one single workflow in n8n connected to Supabase, where all client information and credentials are stored. This way, when a new client is onboarded, I only need to add their credentials and parameters into Supabase, and the workflow should automatically work for them — without duplicating flows.

Scope of Work:
	•	Set up a Supabase database with tables for clients, leads, and interactions.
	•	Implement Row Level Security to ensure data isolation per client.
	•	Build a parametrized n8n workflow that:
	1.	Receives leads (via form, webhook, or Google Sheets).
	2.	Fetches client credentials and parameters from Supabase.
	3.	Executes API integrations (e.g., Retell AI, Twilio, etc.).
	4.	Stores results back into Supabase.
	5.	Sends customized notifications to the client.
	•	Enable prompt, notification, and integration customization via Supabase.
	•	Provide clear documentation so I can easily onboard new clients by just updating Supabase records.

Freelancer Requirements:
	•	Proven experience with n8n and Supabase.
	•	Strong skills in API integrations (experience with Retell AI/Twilio is a big plus).
	•	Ability to design scalable and well-structured workflows.
	•	Good communication skills to explain how the system can be managed after delivery.

Final Goal:
A single, fully automated workflow where onboarding a new client only requires adding their info in Supabase — with no need to recreate or duplicate workflows in n8n.

data.title: B2b automation (n8n)
data.description:
## **Project Overview**
We need an experienced **n8n workflow developer** to build a complete 7-stage B2B sales automation system. This is NOT basic Zapier work—it requires advanced logic, API integrations, and complex multi-step workflows.

***

## **Required Skills Assessment**
**Before applying, confirm you can:**
- ✅ Build complex n8n workflows with 20+ nodes
- ✅ Work with APIs (CRM, email, calendar, document generation)
- ✅ Create conditional logic with If/Switch nodes
- ✅ Handle webhooks, HTTP requests, and data transformations
- ✅ Integrate with: HubSpot/Pipedrive, Gmail/Outlook, Google Calendar, DocuSign/PandaDoc
- ✅ Debug workflow errors and optimize performance
- ✅ Document workflows for client handover

**If you can't do 80% of the above, this project isn't for you.**

***

## **The 7 Automation Stages You'll Build**

### **Stage 1: Lead Generation & Prospecting**
**What it does:** Captures leads from multiple sources and enriches data automatically

**Your tasks:**
- Set up webhook nodes for website forms, landing pages
- Build data enrichment workflows (Clearbit/DropContact API)
- Create deduplication logic to prevent duplicate entries
- Auto-populate CRM with clean, enriched lead data
- Send Slack/email notifications for high-value leads

**Complexity:** Medium (5-8 nodes per workflow)

***

### **Stage 2: Lead Qualification & Nurturing**
**What it does:** Scores leads and sends targeted email sequences based on behavior

**Your tasks:**
- Build BANT/MEDDIC scoring system with point calculations
- Create If/Else branches for different lead segments
- Set up automated email drip campaigns (Mailchimp/Gmail API)
- Track email opens, clicks, and website behavior
- Move qualified leads to sales pipeline automatically

**Complexity:** High (15-20 nodes, complex logic)

***

### **Stage 3: Sales Pipeline Management**
**What it does:** Manages opportunities through sales stages with automatic updates

**Your tasks:**
- Create opportunity records in CRM when leads qualify
- Build meeting scheduling workflows (Calendly/Google Calendar)
- Automate pipeline stage progression based on activities
- Send reminder notifications for stalled deals
- Generate weekly pipeline reports for management

**Complexity:** Medium-High (10-15 nodes)

***

### **Stage 4: Deal Closing & Contract Automation**
**What it does:** Generates proposals, handles e-signatures, creates invoices

**Your tasks:**
- Build proposal generation (PandaDoc/Google Docs templates)
- Create e-signature workflows with DocuSign integration
- Set up contract reminder sequences for unsigned docs
- Automate invoice creation upon contract signing
- Trigger customer onboarding workflow after deal closes

**Complexity:** High (20+ nodes, multiple integrations)

***

### **Stage 5: Customer Onboarding**
**What it does:** Welcomes new customers and manages implementation process

**Your tasks:**
- Create welcome email sequences with login credentials
- Generate project tasks in Asana/Trello automatically
- Schedule kickoff meetings with new customers
- Send progress updates to internal teams via Slack
- Collect onboarding feedback through automated surveys

**Complexity:** Medium (8-12 nodes)

***

### **Stage 6: Customer Success & Expansion**
**What it does:** Monitors customer health and identifies upsell opportunities

**Your tasks:**
- Build health scoring based on usage data/survey responses
- Create at-risk customer alert workflows
- Set up upsell triggers when usage hits thresholds
- Automate quarterly business review scheduling
- Send success milestone celebration emails

**Complexity:** Medium-High (12-18 nodes)

***

### **Stage 7: Retention & Advocacy**
**What it does:** Manages renewals, referrals, and testimonial collection

**Your tasks:**
- Set up renewal reminder sequences (90/60/30 days out)
- Create referral request workflows for happy customers
- Build testimonial collection and case study workflows
- Automate loyalty program enrollment
- Track and report on customer lifetime value

**Complexity:** Medium (10-15 nodes)

***

## **Technical Requirements**

### **Integrations You Must Handle:**
- **CRM:** HubSpot, Pipedrive, or Salesforce
- **Email:** Gmail API, Outlook, or Mailchimp
- **Calendar:** Google Calendar, Outlook Calendar
- **Documents:** PandaDoc, DocuSign, Google Docs
- **Project Management:** Asana, Trello, or Monday.com
- **Communication:** Slack, Teams notifications
- **Forms:** Typeform, Google Forms webhooks

### **Data Management:**
- Clean data validation and transformation
- Proper error handling for failed API calls
- Webhook security and authentication
- Database/sheet updates without duplicates

***

## **Deliverables Expected**

1. **Working n8n workflows** for all 7 stages
2. **Integration setup** with client's existing tools
3. **Testing documentation** showing each workflow works
4. **Client training materials** (video walkthroughs)
5. **Troubleshooting guide** for common issues
6. **30 days of bug fixes** after initial delivery

***

## **Project Timeline & Budget**

**Timeline:** 2-4 weeks for complete system
**Budget Range:** $1,500 - $4,000 (depending on complexity)
**Payment:** 50% upfront, 50% on completion

***

## **Questions to Ask Yourself:**

1. Can I build workflows with 15-20+ nodes reliably?
2. Have I worked with CRM APIs and webhook integrations?
3. Can I handle complex If/Else logic and data transformations?
4. Do I have experience with document generation APIs?
5. Can I provide ongoing support and troubleshooting?

**If you answered "no" to any of these, please don't apply.**

***

## **What Success Looks Like**

- All 7 workflows run without errors
- Client can see leads automatically flow from capture to close
- Manual tasks are reduced by 70%+ 
- Client sees measurable improvement in conversion rates
- System scales as client grows their business

This is enterprise-level automation work. We pay well, but expect professional results.

data.title: ERPNext / Frappe Developer Needed for Long-Term Customization
data.description:
Description:
We are a growing BPO company seeking an experienced ERPNext / Frappe developer to help us customize and continuously improve our ERPNext solution.

Our system will be central to managing HR, accounting, and employee training, so we are looking for someone who understands business workflows and can adapt ERPNext modules to fit our needs.


Scope of Work:
Customize and enhance ERPNext modules, especially:
- HR: Recruiting pipeline, job portal, and onboarding workflows (we use HROne for payroll and attendance tracking, but may look to expand HR functionality later).
- LMS: Training and onboarding workflows, progress tracking, and integration with HR.
- Accounting: Chart of accounts, multi-company setup, cost centers, and financial reporting.
- Build custom fields, forms, and reports to support operational workflows.
- Integrate ERPNext with other tools we use (Microsoft 365, SharePoint, n8n, etc.).
- Provide ongoing support and improvements as our business grows.


What We’re Looking For:

I already have a first functional version with login and some small features, but I need an experienced team to turn this concept into a solid and scalable product.

I’m looking for a full-stack development team with experience building modern SaaS platforms, capable of integrating multiple APIs, automation flows, and AI-powered tools. The goal is to deliver a functional product within 2 to 5 months.

What I value:

Expected delivery:

Arnau

data.title: URGENT: Supabase schema nuked — need triage now. (vapi/n8n payloads exist - i know my schema)

there were a bunch of updates made friday (lovable timetamped prompts/records with code updates) along with supabase logs. errors starting hiting in some accounts friday night and through monday. tuesday a nuke hit the database. not sure if events are related(cascaded, etc) or if this was an attack (I do suspect there's a possibility of attack and the timing supports this but also there's too many moving parts for me to see if/how they fit together let alone how much that matters for the fix. I am not trying to get it salvaged/reconstructed in this job, i'm trying to get someone qualified to hop on NOW with me and diagnose exactly where i am quickly so i can start my plan for the salvage/repair/rebuild as fast as possible to get users basic functions back and if possible their leads from the last 30 days from payload data..

data.title: DigitalOcean n8n Server Setup Project
data.description:
We are seeking an experienced DevOps / System Administrator freelancer to set up a robust and secure n8n instance on a DigitalOcean Droplet. This project requires expertise in Linux server administration, Docker, PostgreSQL, and web server configuration (Nginx/Caddy) for SSL.
Our Goal: To have a fully functional, secure, and scalable n8n automation platform ready for production use.  Our first stage is for interal projects.  Second stage is automating internal workflows with agentic linked processes.  Third stage is to take some of these processes and integrate them into a directory as a service we are building that will have Multi-tentant consideratioins. 
Key Requirements & Scope of Work:
DigitalOcean Droplet Setup:


Provision a basic DigitalOcean Droplet (e.g., 1GB RAM, 1 vCPU, 25GB SSD – we are open to recommendations for a starting size that allows for easy future upgrades).
The setup should be configured in a way that allows for seamless upgrading to a larger instance later, without data loss or significant reconfiguration.
The base configuration/image should be clonable/replicable for setting up additional n8n instances in the future if needed (e.g., via a custom snapshot or a clear provisioning script).
n8n Installation via Docker Compose:


Install n8n using Docker Compose for easy management and scalability.
Configure n8n to use PostgreSQL as its database, with the PostgreSQL data persisted via a Docker Volume. (SQLite is not an option for this setup).
Ensure all n8n data (workflows, credentials, execution history) is persistently stored.
Set up a secure encryption key for n8n credentials.
Domain & SSL Configuration:


Configure the n8n instance to be accessible via the subdomain: auto.holistic-hubs.com. (We will provide access to our DreamHost DNS management for setting up the necessary A/CNAME records, or guide you through it).
Set up a Let's Encrypt SSL certificate for auto.holistic-hubs.com to enable HTTPS, ensuring encrypted traffic. This will likely involve a reverse proxy (e.g., Nginx or Caddy – please specify your preferred solution).
Security & Best Practices:


Firewall Configuration: Implement a robust firewall (e.g., UFW) to only allow necessary incoming traffic (SSH, HTTPS, and any other agreed-upon ports).
SSH Authentication: Configure secure SSH access, ideally using key-based authentication (no password-based SSH access). We will provide an SSHpublickey.
N8n Authentication: Set up basic username/password authentication for accessing the n8n web editor.
Discuss & Implement: We need to have a brief discussion about other relevant security considerations and implement agreed-upon best practices for a production server.
Documentation & Deliverables:


Comprehensive Documentation: Provide clear, concise documentation of the entire setup process, including:
SSH credentials and instructions for access.
n8n login credentials.
Location of key configuration files (Docker Compose, Nginx/Caddy config).
Instructions on how to restart n8n, check logs, and perform basic troubleshooting.
Steps for future n8n and system updates.
Details on the backup strategy (see point 6).
Any relevant security measures implemented.
Confirmation that SSL is working correctly.
Confirmation of persistent data storage.
Backup Strategy Discussion & Setup (Initial):


Discuss and recommend a robust backup strategy for the n8n data (PostgreSQL database, workflows, credentials).
Implement an initial backup solution (e.g., DigitalOcean Droplet backups, or a script to back up the PostgreSQL database to a secure location). We are open to your recommendations here.
Preferred Experience:
Proven experience with DigitalOcean Droplets and cloud server management.
Strong expertise in Docker and Docker Compose.
Proficiency with PostgreSQL setup and management.
Experience with Nginx or Caddy for reverse proxy and SSL configuration.
Solid understanding of Linux server security best practices (firewalls, SSH hardening).
Prior experience with n8n installations is a significant plus.
Experience with GoHighLevel is a plus.  
Excellent communication skills and ability to provide clear technical documentation.
Timeline: We are looking to complete this setup within 1-3 business days of project award, assuming prompt communication and access.
Potential for Ongoing Maintenance: Upon successful completion of this setup project, we would be interested in discussing a separate, ongoing maintenance or support contract for the n8n server, if that is a service you offer.
Please provide:
Your proposed approach to the setup.
An estimated fixed price for the complete project.
Your availability to start.
Examples of similar past work if available.
We look forward to reviewing your proposals!

data.title: Supabase/Postgres Diagnostics for Recovery Options/Salvage Gameplan
data.description:
I NEED SOMEONE WHO CAN JUMP IN NOW and look at my logs with me for an hour.

YOU ARE THE BEST and can help me figure out what the heck just happened in my Supabase/Postgres project. Functions, indexes, maybe(I think yes - and i think no backups possible) schema got nuked around Sept 9th, and I need a top-tier backend/database engineer to jump in, review the logs/data I’ve already pulled, and tell me:
	•	What can we confirm actually happened
	•	How much deeper we can realistically dig before it’s just wasted time
	•	What’s salvageable vs. when it’s smarter to cut and rebuild (we still have n8n and vapi payloads that should be able to reconstruct plus i built the schema so if you are amazing at this stuff we can work together and fill in the gaps and quickly come up with a plan to start repairing so i can get my live users back up and running!

This is crisis triage, not a long rebuild gig. If you’re fluent in Postgres internals, Supabase quirks, WAL/logs/schema diffs, and can quickly map the current state vs. expected schema, I need you now. The mission is to help me stop spinning in circles and chart a clear path forward so we can stabilize TIM and get users back online.

data.title: Conversational AI Specialist Needed (Retell/Vapi, APIs, n8n) to Finalize Real Estate Voice Agent
data.description:
We’re looking for a conversational AI specialist with strong experience in Retell (or Vapi), APIs, and automation platforms (n8n/Make/Zapier) to help us finish a real estate conversational voice agent that’s already ~80% complete.

Our AI agent is currently deployed on Retell AI. It transcribes conversations in real time and, when the user makes a request, it triggers a webhook API call through n8n. The API returns the data, and the agent delivers it back to the caller within the conversation. The architecture is already built — what we need is someone to refine and finish it.

Scope of Work

1.  API Replacement
- Replace the current Zillow-based API (which is returning inaccurate data) with a more reliable and accurate data provider.
- Potential alternatives could include Perplexity’s API or another trusted real estate data source.
- Ensure API responses are properly integrated into the conversational flow without breaking the existing n8n architecture.

2. Prompt Refinement in Retell
- Fine-tune the conversational prompts to make the agent sound natural, professional, and human-like.
- Ensure the flow avoids “walls” or dead ends during conversations.
- Adjust phrasing for compliance (e.g., TCPA opt-in) and proper use of real estate terminology and abbreviations.
- Smooth out edge cases where the agent might misinterpret or respond unnaturally.

3. Testing & Iteration
- Stress-test the agent with different conversation types to ensure accuracy and natural flow.
- Debug and optimize any weak spots in the workflow.

Who We’re Looking For:
- Experience building voice AI agents on platforms like Retell AI or Vapi.
- Strong background in API integration and data flow management.
- Skilled with n8n, Make, or Zapier for workflow automation.
- Comfortable with prompt engineering for conversational AI.
- Bonus: Knowledge of real estate data sources and compliance requirements.

Deliverables:

A fully functional conversational AI agent that:
1. Uses a reliable data API for real estate information.
2. Flows smoothly and naturally during calls.
3. Handles opt-in and compliance language correctly.
4. Documentation of the updated architecture and prompts for our internal team.

data.title: Motion App Automation Engineer (AI Skills • Workflows • Integrations)
data.description:
Seeking a senior freelancer to design, build, and iterate AI-powered skills inside Motion (usemotion.com). You’ll turn messy, real-world inputs (emails, PDFs, forms, links) into clean JSON, tasks/subtasks, calendars, and notifications. Ongoing work across multiple internal workflows—not a one-off project.

What you’ll build (examples, not exhaustive)

Email-triggered skills that extract key data and create task trees with due dates and owners.

Multi-step AI instructions that summarize attachments, classify requests, and populate structured fields.

Automations that post results to Motion Inbox, Slack, and email; optionally push or pull data from Notion, Airtable, Sheets, and CRMs.

Dedupe and update logic that detects addenda or changes and updates existing tasks instead of creating duplicates.

Guardrails for time zones, missing fields, and error handling.

Day-to-day responsibilities

Translate business processes into small, clear Motion skill steps.

Write precise AI prompts and JSON schemas; enforce JSON-only outputs.

Configure triggers and filters and downstream actions.

Map fields across tools; build webhooks and integrations where native connectors fall short.

Document flows, version changes, and create short Looms and playbooks.

Propose improvements for latency, reliability, and human-in-the-loop checkpoints.

Required expertise

Proven Motion skills experience or equivalent AI workflow builders such as Zapier Interfaces, Make, n8n, Retool, or Salesforce Flows with rapid ramp-up to Motion.

Strong prompt engineering for extraction, summarization, and classification.

JSON design, schema validation, and idempotent task creation with dedupe keys.

Integrations with Gmail and Google Workspace, Slack, Notion, Airtable, Sheets, webhooks, and basic REST APIs.

Practical automation hygiene including retries, fallbacks, logging, rate-limit awareness, and PII handling.

Nice to have

PDF parsing tactics, regex, and lightweight Python or Apps Script when needed.

Experience with project and task tools such as Asana or ClickUp and migrating logic to Motion.

Basic front-end for simple internal dashboards.

Familiarity with procurement and operations workflows from intake to planning to submission.

Tools you might touch
Motion AI Skills • Gmail API and GSuite • Slack • Notion and Airtable and Sheets • Zapier and Make and n8n • Webhooks • Apps Script and Python

Initial deliverables (first 1–2 weeks)

Audit of our current Motion setup and quick wins list.

One production-ready skill with documentation.

Reusable JSON schema and naming conventions for tasks, subtasks, tags, and dedupe keys.

Error-handling and a missing-info request pattern.

Success metrics (30/60/90)

30 days: two to three stable skills live, under 2% error rate, documentation in place.

60 days: shared library of prompts and schemas; average setup time per new workflow under 4 hours.

90 days: monitoring and update playbook; stakeholders can self-serve basic edits.

Engagement

Part-time to start; expand based on velocity and reliability.

Hourly or milestone-based. We value quick iterations, clear communication, and clean handoff docs.

NDA and light security practices required, with no external data sharing and appropriate handling of PII.

How to apply (please include):

Three to five links or short descriptions of automation builds you’ve shipped, ideally Motion or similar.

data.title: N8N automation for our support chat
data.description:
PLEASE: Do not respond using AI, I will not READ. If you're interested respond with just a few lines that you basically read everything, you believe it's possible, and the timeline... bonus if you've done something similar before. 

------

We’re looking for someone highly experienced with N8N and AI prompting to help us move our entire support system from gleap.com into a fully automated, AI-driven flow.

When a customer sends us a message, the AI should be able to collect all the context it needs before replying. That means pulling details from Stripe about billing and plans, checking our internal database and systems, looking at previous conversations, and even reviewing other activity or data points that could be relevant.

Once it has the context, the AI should respond in a natural and conversational way, as if a human agent were behind the keyboard. The tone really matters here...we want answers that feel warm, clear, and personal, not robotic.

From there, the AI should route each request in the right direction. If it’s a feature suggestion, it should log that suggestion and thank the customer and let them know that the feature was launched once it does. If it’s a bug report, it should create a detailed ticket in our tasks board, let the customer know it’s being looked at, and post the full context for the developer. And if it’s a how-to or general question, the AI should simply answer it on the spot with the right information.

For bugs especially, the AI will also need to manage the updates. Whenever a developer comments on or updates the ticket, the AI should pass that message back to the customer. For example: “The team is discussing it and getting closer... thanks for your patience.” When the fix is complete, the AI should follow up with: “This should now be resolved. Please give it another try and let me know if it’s still an issue. If so, I’ll reopen the ticket for you.” If a ticket is taking longer than expected, the AI should check in with the customer every so often to reassure them: “Sorry for the delay, we’re still on it and I’ll keep you updated.”

The most important part of this flow is the loop. Nothing should ever fall through the cracks. Every question, bug, or feature request should be acknowledged, tracked, updated, and closed out with the customer... or reopened if needed. The AI should always be the one keeping the thread alive until the customer is truly satisfied.

data.title: Notion Marketing Content Engine Development (MVP in 1–2 Weeks)
data.description:
Overview

We’re a fast-moving SaaS company building the foundation for our marketing content engine. Our goal is to stand up a lightweight but powerful v1 system within 1–2 weeks that centralizes our brand knowledge, supports content creation workflows, and lays the groundwork for multi-channel distribution.

Notion will be the primary hub for this MVP. Additional systems (distribution, scheduling, analytics) will follow in later phases. The immediate focus is speed to launch: we want a functional system that supports idea intake, content planning, and production immediately, with RSS feeds automated into Notion as inspiration fuel.

Objectives

- Create an organized brand repository in Notion for:
   : Brand assets (logos, templates, design references)
   : Messaging pillars, personas, product library
   : Voice & tone guidelines, proof points, positioning docs
- Set up an RSS / inspiration intake pipeline (via Make, Zapier, or n8n) to bring external content ideas directly into Notion.
- Build a content calendar workflow in Notion:
   : Calendar view for monthly editorial planning
   : Kanban view for content stages (Idea → Draft → Review → Published)
   : Metadata for personas, messaging pillars, campaigns, CTAs
- Design a content production template library for blogs, LinkedIn posts, ad copy, landing pages, and decks.
- Enable team collaboration in Notion: ownership, deadlines, review workflow.
- Document a simple MVP process flow for ideation → content creation → publishing prep.
- Provide clear recommendations for Phase 2: automating content distribution across LinkedIn, blog CMS, HubSpot/email, and analytics tracking.

Deliverables (Phase 1, 1–2 Weeks)

- Fully configured Notion workspace including:
   : Brand Repository database

   : Inspiration / RSS intake database (automated feed integration live)
   : Content Calendar database with relations, rollups, and views
- 3–4 ready-to-use content templates (blog, social, ad, landing page)
- Automation flow set up (RSS → Notion)
- Documentation / Loom walkthrough of the system
- Next-step recommendations for Phase 2 automation (distribution + analytics)

Desired Skills

Must-Have

- Strong experience structuring systems in Notion (databases, relations, formulas, templates)
- Expertise with automation platforms (Zapier, Make, n8n) to connect RSS feeds into Notion
- Background in marketing operations / content workflows
- Familiarity with SaaS and B2B marketing environments

Nice-to-Have

- Knowledge of distribution automation (social schedulers, CMS, HubSpot)
- Familiarity with analytics/UTM tracking for marketing performance

Success Criteria

- System is live and usable within 1–2 weeks
-Team can begin populating brand assets and content ideas immediately

Why This Project Matters

We’re shifting to a repeatable, content-driven demand generation model. This v1 system is the launchpad — if done well, it will evolve into our company-wide marketing operating system. We want someone who can combine Notion build expertise with marketing process design and automation know-how to help us hit the ground running.

data.title: N8N Setup and Integration Specialist Needed
data.description:
**Job Title: Freelance Automation and AI Integration Specialist**

**Job Description:**

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated freelancer to assist us in setting up N8N, an open-source workflow automation tool, on our dedicated server. The successful candidate will not only be responsible for the installation and configuration of N8N but will also play a crucial role in developing a ChatGPT clone that is specifically trained on our proprietary data. 

We want to setup a hosted version of N8N to limit costs and use for a Chatgpt clone that is trained on everything related to pool, billiards  or any other cue sport.

We want our web user and most importantly our app users to be able to ask the ChatGPT clone a question about anything billliards, pool, carom, 3 cushion, Snooker, rules for every type game, history of billiards, specific dimensions of every pool table size from every manufacturer, physics of cue action and ball collision, upcomingpublictournaments and current location of every pool all in the US and abroad, and anything we train the LLM and ChatGPT clone on. 

The Chat clone for pool needs to be integrated into our shopify store and our app.

The integration can be as simple as a link to an external UI that appears seamless to our users. 

The chat clone needs to take text and audio input. The chat clone must remember the subject history and relate to the current question. 

We will provide all the training data. 

The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in automation tools, artificial intelligence, and application integrations, particularly with e-commerce platforms like Shopify. You will work closely with our team to ensure that the ChatGPT clone functions seamlessly and meets our specific requirements for customer interaction and data processing.

Key Responsibilities:
- Install and configure N8N on our new server, ensuring optimal performance and security.
- Develop and customize a ChatGPT clone that is accurately trained on our selected data sets, focusing on our specific data.
- Integrate the LLM with our Shopify store, google, and Apple app to improve operational efficiency and customer interactions.
- Conduct thorough testing and debugging to ensure all components of the system operate smoothly and efficiently.
- Provide ongoing support and maintenance for the N8N, LLM, and ChatGPT clone integration, including troubleshooting and implementing updates as necessary.

Qualifications:
- Proven experience with N8N or similar workflow automation tools.
- Strong understanding of AI technologies, particularly in natural language processing and model training.
- Experience with Shopify app development and integration.
- Familiarity with data mining techniques and tools.
- Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
- Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks effectively.
- Strong communication skills to collaborate with team members and stakeholders.

If you have the relevant experience and are passionate about automation and AI integrations, we would love to hear from you! Please submit your portfolio or examples of previous work related to automation and AI, along with your proposal, detailing your approach to this project, estimated timelines, and your hourly or project-based rates. Join us in revolutionizing our operations and enhancing our customer engagement through innovative technology solutions!

data.title: Build an n8n SMS AI Agent Integrated with Facebook Ads and GoHighLevel
data.description:

We have a working n8n automation system serving automotive customization shops that handles customer SMS conversations through AI agents integrated with GoHighLevel CRM. The core functionality is built and operational: we need an experienced engineer to optimize performance, enhance scalability, and implement Facebook Marketing API integration for advanced customer intelligence.

Current Tech Stack
n8n (self-hosted) - Main automation platform
GoHighLevel API - CRM/SMS integration
Supabase (Postgres) - Conversation memory & analytics storage
Stripe API - Dynamic payment processing
Claude AI - Conversational agent via API
Slack - Error notifications & human escalation
Facebook Marketing API - Custom audiences & conversion tracking (to be integrated)

What's Already Built
✅ Main AI agent handling customer SMS conversations
✅ Sub-agent architecture (payment processing, scheduling, GHL integration)
✅ Database schema for conversation memory
✅ Stripe integration with dynamic pricing
✅ Human escalation system with Slack notifications
✅ GHL custom field management & contact updates

What We Need
Primary Focus: Optimization, Scalability & Marketing Intelligence
Database & Memory Optimization
Enhance conversation threading and agent attribution
Implement proper indexing for performance at scale
Add confidence tracking and escalation metadata
Optimize memory retrieval for multi-turn conversations
Design analytics schema for conversation intelligence & intent scoring

Facebook Marketing API Integration
Custom Audiences: Sync high-intent prospects from SMS conversations
Lookalike Audiences: Create expansion audiences based on conversion patterns
Conversion Tracking: Feed purchase/booking events back to Facebook
Intent Ranking: Score conversations for engagement quality and purchase likelihood
Attribution Pipeline: Connect SMS interactions to Facebook ad performance

Workflow Refinement
Implement robust error handling with retry logic
Add comprehensive logging for debugging
Create reusable sub-workflow patterns
Optimize API call efficiency and rate limiting
Build conversation analytics pipeline to Supabase

Scalability Enhancements
Design for multi-client deployment
Implement environment-specific configurations
Add monitoring and performance metrics
Create deployment documentation
Multi-tenant Facebook ad account management

Required Skills
3+ years n8n experience (HTTP Request, Function, Code, SplitInBatches, Merge, IF nodes)
GoHighLevel API expertise (contacts, custom fields, webhooks)
Facebook Marketing API experience (Custom Audiences, Conversions API, audience management)
Database optimization (Postgres/Supabase preferred)
API integration patterns (Stripe, AI APIs, webhook handling)
Error handling & monitoring design

Nice-to-Have
Experience with conversational AI systems
Customer Data Platform (CDP) architecture
Marketing attribution and analytics
Automotive/SME business process knowledge
Multi-tenant SaaS architecture experience
GDPR/privacy compliance for customer data

Deliverables
Optimized n8n workflows with comprehensive error handling
Enhanced database schema with analytics tables and proper indexing
Facebook Marketing API integration (Custom Audiences, Conversions, Lookalikes)
Conversation intelligence pipeline with intent scoring algorithms
Performance monitoring setup and documentation
Deployment guide for scaling to multiple clients
Code documentation and architectural diagrams

Timeline: 2-3 weeks
Budget: $300 USD (Fixed Price)

To Apply:
Share your n8n portfolio/examples
Describe your Facebook Marketing API integration experience
Outline experience with conversation analytics and customer intelligence
Describe your GoHighLevel API experience
Outline your approach to optimizing existing automation systems
Confirm availability for 2-3 week timeline

Note: This is optimization work on an existing system, not building from scratch. The Facebook integration is a key component for creating a complete marketing intelligence loop from SMS conversations back to ad targeting and optimization.

data.title: AI Agent Coach/Consultant (Automation & Knowledge Transfer)
data.description:
AI Agent Coach/Consultant (Automation & Knowledge Transfer)

Goal: I’m looking for a senior freelancer to act as a coach/consultant on AI agents. You’ll advise, review, and guide fixes for agents I’ve already built (some have errors), and help shape new agents from the idea stage. You won’t be the primary builder day-to-day, but you can take over and build an agent end-to-end if we decide a project needs it.
End goal: Deploy AI agents that replace repetitive/manual tasks in our business while upskilling me—I want to learn how agents are designed, built, evaluated, and maintained so I can own future iterations.

What you’ll do

* Audit existing agents: Review architecture, prompts, tools, data flows, and logs. Identify root causes and quick wins.
* Coach & guide fixes: Pair with me to debug, refine prompts/tool-calls, add guardrails, and improve reliability—without taking over the whole build.
* Design new agents: Help with ideation, scoping, and technical design (capabilities, tools, context strategy, evaluation plan).
* Standards & playbooks: Define best practices for prompting, evaluation, logging/monitoring, versioning, and cost/latency control.


Must-have experience
* Proven track record shipping LLM/agent systems (tool use, function calling, multi-tool orchestration).
* Strong prompt engineering and structured outputs (JSON/JSON Schema), tool design, and context/RAG strategies.
* Solid software engineering (Python and/or TypeScript/JavaScript), code review, testing, Git.
* Extensive hands-on with n8n: robust workflow design, error handling/retries, credentials, webhooks, sub-workflows, queues/rate limits, and production hardening.
* Production deployments on Railway: running microservices/workers/cron jobs, managing env vars & secrets, logs/metrics, and basic CI/CD.
* Experience with other relevant platforms: at least one of Make/Zapier (workflow automation), Render/Vercel/Fly.io (app hosting), or LangChain/LangGraph (agent frameworks).
* Excellent communicator and coach who transfers knowledge clearly.

Engagement
* Part-time, hourly. Start with a paid diagnostic + action plan, then weekly sessions + async reviews.
* EU-friendly time overlap preferred. English required
* Deliverables (initial phase)
* Agent Audit Report: Issues, quick wins, prioritized roadmap.
* Coaching Sessions: Live reviews + written follow-ups.
* Automation Plan: Shortlist of manual processes to automate, ROI estimates, and success metrics.
* Playbook: Checklists for prompts, testing, logging, release, and incident handling.


Success looks like:
* Deployed agents that meaningfully reduce manual work (hours/week saved or cycle-time reduction).
* I can design, adjust, and ship agent updates independently.

How to apply
Please include:
* A short note on two agent projects you’ve delivered (what they did, stack, your role, results).
* Your hourly rate and weekly availability.
* One paragraph on how you’d run a 60–90 min paid diagnostic for an agent with intermittent tool errors.

data.title: N8N + API Expert Needed (Zoho CRM ↔ CloudTalk Integration)
data.description:
We are building a mission-critical integration between Zoho CRM and CloudTalk (Power Dialer) using n8n (self-hosted). This project is API-heavy and requires deep technical expertise — not just drag-and-drop node configuration.

Scope:
	•	Zoho CRM → CloudTalk: Automatically create/update leads and assign them to campaigns via API.
	•	CloudTalk → Zoho CRM: Capture call dispositions via webhook/API and map them back to Zoho pipeline stages.
	•	Handle complex API requirements:
	•	Zoho CRM OAuth2 + token refresh
	•	CloudTalk campaign creation & assignment (non-trivial, limited endpoints)
	•	Pagination & rate-limit handling
	•	Retry/backoff strategies for failed API calls
	•	Exactly-once data sync (no duplicates)
	•	Implement robust monitoring & logging: error handling, DLQ (dead-letter queue), correlation IDs.

Requirements:
	•	Proven track record with API-first n8n integrations (using HTTP Request, Function nodes, custom auth flows).
	•	Deep understanding of OAuth2, pagination, rate limits, retries, and idempotency.
	•	Experience with CRM + telephony tools (Zoho, CloudTalk, Aircall, JustCall, etc.) preferred.
	•	Ability to deliver production-grade workflows with full documentation.

Timeline:
	•	Base version (Zoho ↔ CloudTalk sync + dispositions) by end of September.

data.title: Head of Automation (Remote to Long-Term)
data.description:
This role is the first step in a bigger journey. You’ll work directly with the founder to map, streamline, and automate our internal operations. And as the company scales:
➡️ You’ll take full responsibility for building and leading our remote automation & operations team.

We’re creating a lean, digital-first, and highly scalable system. Your job is to design and run that system from day one – transforming it into the backbone of the business, with the potential to grow into its own service offering.

What You’ll Do

Document and analyze daily operations (via screen shares, async recordings, team sessions)

Collaborate with founder and team to map all core processes

Spot opportunities to simplify, standardize, or automate – and explain why

Build automations with tools like n8n, Make.com, Zapier, APIs, or light coding (Python/JavaScript)

Define SOPs, workflows, and documentation standards

Set up internal collaboration tools for remote work

Recruit, onboard, and lead a remote team for automation & operations (non-negotiable)

Possible hires include: Support Assistants, Content/Marketing Automation, Data Ops, and QA/Documentation

Your Role in the System

You’ll architect the infrastructure that keeps people, processes, and tools in sync across time zones. That means choosing the right stack, creating documentation, and ensuring no single point of failure.

📌 Our automation mindset: We prioritize clarity and efficiency over complexity. The goal is smart, resilient systems – not automation for its own sake.

Requirements

Hands-on experience with automation platforms (n8n, Make.com, Zapier, etc.)

Optional coding skills (Python, JavaScript, API integrations)

Strong process-mapping & system-design abilities

Excellent documentation and communication skills

Leadership qualities – you enjoy building systems and guiding teams

Fluent English (spoken & written)

German skills are a plus (some tools and docs are in German)

First 30 Days

Document all critical processes with input from the team & founder

Deliver the first high-value automations

Set up collaboration infrastructure (PM tools, SOP libraries, dashboards)

Propose team structure and help hire the first assistant

Build the foundation for a scalable, independent operations backbone

Weekly Planning & Accountability

Each week begins with a short plan from you:

✅ What you’ll deliver

✅ How you’ll approach it

✅ Any support needed

This keeps us aligned without micromanagement. We work on trust, ownership, and results.

Payment Terms

Weekly fixed-rate via Upwork

Payment after each week, based on agreed outcomes delivered

No timesheets – just communication and accountability

Application Process (Both Steps Paid)

Step 1 – Automation Test
After a quick intro call, you’ll get a small test (e.g. a basic LinkedIn/Facebook automation).

Draft a 1–2 page concept (≤2 hours)

Deliver a working version within 2–3 days

Step 2 – Real-World Use Case
If there’s a fit, you’ll handle a real company process (limited tool access) to test live collaboration.
➡️ Both stages are compensated at your weekly rate.

Location & Availability

Fully remote

Preferred time zone: within ±6 hours CET

Weekly check-ins with founder (async or live)

To Apply, Please Answer:

Why does this role excite you?

What’s the most impactful automation/system you’ve built?

How would you design processes so they don’t rely on one person?

What’s your proposed weekly rate?

Roughly how many hours would you work for that rate – and what would a “typical week of results” look like?

Would you like me to make this more concise and punchy (like a LinkedIn job post), or keep it long-form and detailed (like Upwork/WeWorkRemotely style)?

data.title: AI Developer Needed for Real Estate Deal Document Parsing Platform
data.description:
AI Developer Needed to Build Real Estate Deal Pipeline Platform

We are looking for an experienced AI + automation developer (or team) to build a production-ready platform that ingests highly variable real estate deal documents, extracts and normalizes structured data, calculates institutional KPIs, evaluates risks and opportunities, scores deals, and manages a dynamic, searchable pipeline.

Documents include Offering Memoranda, rent rolls, T12s, contracts, and due diligence files — often arriving in different formats (scanned PDFs, inconsistent Excel templates, narrative-heavy OMs, mixed broker layouts). The system must handle document variability intelligently and provide consistent, audit-ready outputs.

Key requirements:

End-to-end automation pipeline: ingestion → AI parsing → KPI calculation → scoring → UI

AI-powered document classification & structured data extraction

Institutional-grade KPI calculations & deal scoring

AI-driven summaries: risks, opportunities, missing data

Clean dashboard with search, filters, statuses, attachments & provenance

Configurable prompts, scoring weights, and KPI thresholds (non-technical edits)

Full traceability & versioning for auditability

Preferred tech: OpenAI GPT-4o, n8n, Airtable (or Supabase + Retool/Next.js), pgvector/Pinecone for semantic search.

Screening questions:

How would you design an AI system to ingest highly variable real estate documents, extract structured data, normalize it, and maintain provenance?

What tools or frameworks would you use to parse PDFs, Excel rent rolls, and T12s from multiple brokers?

How would you make scoring thresholds, KPI calculations, and AI prompts configurable for non-technical users?

Please see attached for more information.

data.title: 📣 Seeking Growth-Minded Marketing Partner for Cold Outreach, Automation, and Systems Building
data.description:
About Us:

We’re two sister companies—MemberFix, a premium WordPress membership site development & support agency, and MemberHost, an extremely high-performance hosting platform for eLearning and membership sites running on WordPress.

Past and present clients include:

- Echelon Front Academy (of Jocko Willink fame)
- Nomad Capitalist
- Authority Hacker
- Techserve Alliance
- Timcast (Tim Pool's membership)
- David Pakman (3.2M+ YouTube followers)

...and many other illustrious and wonderful organizations.

Both companies are profitable, stable, and run by a world class team of technical pros. But we’re not growing as fast as we'd like—and we’re looking to change that...

That’s where you come in!

The Opportunity:

We're looking to hire a marketing-savvy team member who can help drive growth through:

🧊 Cold Outreach – Lead generation, segmentation, and outbound campaigns via email and LinkedIn, calls, etc.

⚙️ Systems & Automation – Use tools like n8n, Zapier, Make.com, PhantomBuster, etc. to build scalable, modular pipelines

🛠️ Process Creation – Develop SOPs so campaigns aren’t reliant on one person

📈 Experimentation & Data – Run, track, and iterate on campaigns based on clear metrics

This is not a generic marketing gig, it's a partnership. We’re looking for a systems thinker—someone who can take the seed of an idea (or a half-baked list) and build real-world leadgen machines around it.

And we're looking to partner with somebody long term to help us grow to become the #1 organizations in our space—and we're already well on our way.

Our partnerships include:

- LearnDash
- WPFusion
- MemberPress
- MemberMouse
- Paid Memberships Pro
- Memberium
- Gamipress
- FunnelKit

...and other big players in our space.

Why We’re Hiring:

Right now, cold email is tying our founder’s brain into a pretzel 🧠🥨. 

We’ve got some promising lists of prospects, a fantastic reputation in our space with over 10+ years of experience, and lots of ideas—but not enough experience or availability to get consistent results. We’re also aware that the tools and APIs can get expensive fast, so we want to make sure we're using them strategically.

Our goal is to grow ambitiously but not wastefully.

If you can help us stop “making it up as we go” and instead build repeatable, ROI-positive systems, then we want to hear from you.

The Ideal Candidate:

✅ You've run successful outbound campaigns before
✅ You're comfortable with omnichannel (email, socials, ads, etc.)
✅ You're all about results
✅ You know tools like Apify, Clay, Sales Navigator, Apollo, Instantly, Lemlist, n8n, etc.
✅ You can build automation workflows competently and know how to work with APIs
✅ You understand how to structure campaigns
✅ You love AI and use it extensively
✅ You can communicate clearly and own a process without needing micro-management
✅ Bonus if you’ve worked with WordPress, membership sites, eLearning sites, etc.
✅ Bonus if you can manage other sub-contractors for various activities that might be needed in your role (e.g. enrichment, automations building, etc.)

What We Offer:

A chance to work with two aligned but distinct businesses—MemberFix (services) and MemberHost (productized hosting), directly with the founders!

A smart, lean and passionate team that moves quickly, takes extreme pride in the quality of their work and service, and values autonomy / flexibility.

Competitive pay that goes up very quickly if you generate real results. Our motto: pay people what they're worth.

Long-term potential if it’s a good fit.... CMO ;)

To Apply:

Please share:

- A quick intro and why this role interests you

- One or two examples of cold outreach systems you’ve built or campaigns you’ve run

- Any relevant tools, APIs, or automations you’ve used

- Your availability and preferred working arrangement (hourly? monthly retainer?)

Let’s grow these businesses—systematically, scalably, and profitably. 🚀

Thanks for your time and good luck!

Vic Dorfman
Founder - MemberFix, MemberHost

p.s. no agencies, please. I'm looking to bring somebody onto our team.

data.title: Experienced Chatbot Builder - Must be based in the Philippines

------

What We’re Looking For:

- Familiarity with platforms like Zapier, Make.com, n8n, Airtable, ElevenLabs, Voiceflow, or similar.

Position Details:

- Full-time, permanent role – 40 hours per week

Seeking an automation expert to create a series of longform tutorials and short “how-to” videos. about integrating an electronic signature platform with tools like Zapier, n8n, and similar.

Requirements:

- Prior experience recording tutorial videos (please provide samples).
- Strong knowledge of automation/integration platforms.
- Ability to explain technical workflows clearly.

data.title: AI & GHL Expert Needed for Custom Automation Projects
data.description:
We are looking for a highly skilled AI & Automation Specialist to support projects that combine large language models (LLMs) with GoHighLevel (GHL) automation. The ideal candidate has hands-on experience working with ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, and other LLMs, as well as expertise in workflow automation inside GHL.

You’ll be responsible for designing, implementing, and optimizing automation systems that integrate AI into business workflows.

⸻

Responsibilities
	•	Develop and optimize custom workflows inside GoHighLevel (triggers, actions, conditional logic).
	•	Integrate ChatGPT, Gemini, and other LLMs into existing workflows for enhanced automation.
	•	Build AI-driven sub-models or fine-tuned solutions to handle specific tasks (e.g., content creation, lead nurturing, summarization).
	•	Work with APIs and third-party tools (Zapier, Make, n8n, webhooks) to connect LLM outputs with GHL automations.
	•	Troubleshoot, refine, and scale automation systems for performance and reliability.
	•	Provide best practices for maintaining and improving AI-powered workflows.

⸻

Required Skills & Experience
	•	Proven expertise with ChatGPT, Gemini, Claude, and other LLMs.
	•	Strong knowledge of sub-models / fine-tuned models and how to implement them in workflows.
	•	Deep experience with GoHighLevel CRM and workflow automations.
	•	Hands-on experience with API integrations, webhooks, and automation platforms (Zapier, Make, n8n).
	•	Ability to translate business processes into efficient AI + GHL automations.
	•	Problem-solving mindset, with the ability to work independently and deliver results.

⸻

Nice to Have
	•	Experience in real estate or service-based business automation.
	•	Familiarity with multi-step lead nurturing sequences and AI-driven personalization.
	•	Knowledge of compliance (e.g., A2P messaging, data handling) in automation workflows.

⸻

Deliverables
	•	At least one fully functional GHL automation workflow powered by AI.
	•	Documentation of workflow design and implementation.
	•	Recommendations for scaling AI integrations into other parts of the business.

⸻

Project Type
	•	Freelance / Contract
	•	Ongoing collaboration possible based on performance

⸻

How to Apply

Please include in your proposal:
	1.	Examples of AI + automation projects you’ve worked on (screenshots, descriptions, or case studies).
	2.	Specific LLMs and sub-models you’ve used and how you integrated them.
	3.	Your experience with GoHighLevel automations (calendars, forms, pipelines, workflows).
	4.	Your hourly rate or project rate.

data.title: Senior Builder for Outbound Voice AI (Vapi/Retell, Twilio, GoHighLevel, n8n)
data.description:
We’re implementing an outbound Voice AI for Merchant Cash Advance (MCA) lead gen. This is not a research toy; it must place real calls at scale, qualify, log to GoHighLevel, and stay inside TCPA/TSR and state recording laws. Stack we expect: Vapi.ai or Retell, Twilio (DIDs, SIP, STIR/SHAKEN, CNAM), Node.js/Python, GoHighLevel (webhooks/API), n8n for orchestration.

We prefer practitioners who have shipped outbound voice systems, understand number reputation, and can show live artifacts (not slides).

Scope (initial SOW)

Voice Agent & Flows

Outbound agent on Vapi or Retell with barge-in, escalation, and fallbacks.

Branching script for MCA qualification (funding need, monthly revenue band, time in business, negative days, # open positions/holdback %, industry).

Voicemail handling, retry/backoff, and callback scheduling.

Telephony & Reputation

Twilio setup: local-presence number pools, CNAM registration, STIR/SHAKEN attestation strategy, answer-rate and spam-flag monitoring, dial-window enforcement across US time zones.

CRM & Orchestration

GoHighLevel integration (contacts/opportunities, transcripts, recordings, consent flags).

Canonical funnel events: Dialed → Connected → Qualified → AppStarted → AppComplete → Offer → Funded.

n8n workflows for post-call automations (tagging, SMS/email, routing).

Compliance & Logging

DNC/TCPA gates, opt-out handling (voice/SMS STOP/email), recording-consent line with two-party branching.

Structured logs, daily exports, and dashboards for answer rate, connect rate, qual rate, cost per connected call.

Docs & Handoff

Runbook, env/config docs, credential inventory, and deployment instructions.

All infra runs in our Twilio/GHL/cloud; code in our repo.

Acceptance Criteria (MVP)

500–1,000 test contacts processed with zero DNC violations; ≥95% field capture accuracy; working consent line/state branching.

GHL shows contacts/opportunities + transcripts/recordings + event trail for all calls.

Daily CSV/JSON export: volume, answer rate, connected minutes, qualified count, cost per connected call.

Clear playbook for SHAKEN/CNAM, number rotation, and spam-flag remediation.

How to Apply (read carefully — proposals that miss items will be archived)

Start your first line with: Pineapple 112
(Do not explain it. Just start with that exact string.)

A) Two-sentence credibility check

In exactly two sentences, describe one outbound voice project that failed at first and what you changed to fix it.

B) 5–7 minute unedited Loom (mandatory)

Say the phrase in the first 30 seconds. Show:

A live outbound test call from your stack to your phone, do one barge-in + one branch.

Twilio screens for number pools/CNAM/attestation (blur secrets) + where you monitor reputation.

A GoHighLevel webhook/API log receiving structured outcomes.

One n8n flow reacting to a call event and updating GHL (note/tag/SMS).

C) Architecture & Flow (concise bullets or a PNG diagram)

Include:

Vapi vs Retell choice for outbound at scale and why.

Concurrency model (pacing, retries, backoff) and how you avoid reputation burn.

Local presence + time windows; include one explicit rule (e.g., handling 212 on Fridays).

Failure handling for ASR/TTS errors, voicemail detection, and recontact logic.

D) Compliance & Reputation Playbook

Your DNC/TCPA/TSR approach: where you source scrubs, how you store consent proof, and opt-out flows (voice/SMS/email).

Recording consent: the exact disclosure line you’ll use for two-party states and branching behavior.

STIR/SHAKEN: how you get A/B attestation, CNAM registration, and your remediation steps when flagged.

Name the tools/dashboards you use to monitor reputation and the thresholds that trigger number rotation.

E) Data & Integrations (show your homework)

Propose a GoHighLevel field map for contact/opportunity and the event names we’ll use.

Paste two sample webhook JSON payloads you will emit:

connected (with captured fields + consent pointer).

qualified (with transcript URL + recording URL).

Paste a Node.js (CommonJS) Express snippet (no TypeScript, no frameworks beyond Express) handling a Vapi/Retell event and posting to GHL.

Include one n8n workflow export snippet or screenshot: HTTP In → transform → GHL Note/Tag → conditional SMS.

F) Cost Model (numbers must reconcile)

Assume 100,000 connected calls/month, 2.5 min average connected duration. Provide a line-item estimate:

Twilio per-minute, number rental, CNAM; your answer-rate assumptions.

Vapi/Retell, STT/TTS provider, storage for recordings/transcripts.

Compute cost per connected call and cost per qualified at 3%, 5%, 8% qualify rates.

List exactly 3 levers to get under $0.20/call and the tradeoff of each.

G) Anti-leak & Attribution

Outline a call fingerprinting approach (per-lead HMAC in links/docs). Paste a 10–20 line server-side validator (any language) that checks the token and flags mismatches.

H) Security & Ops

Where recordings/transcripts live; paste an example S3 bucket policy using SSE-KMS and a lifecycle rule.

Paste one example log line and one SQL (or JSONata) query that computes Connect→Qualified by opener variant for yesterday’s cohort.

State your on-call/incident routine and hotfix approach for a broken dial window or DNC gate.

I) Delivery Plan & Availability

3-week MVP: dated milestones + acceptance criteria aligned to the section above.

Weeks 4–8: the first three improvements you’d ship and why (e.g., A/B harness, number reputation, doc collection, n8n automations).

Team shape (roles/hours/week), timezone in ISO offset (e.g., -05:00), and your weekly availability in America/Chicago business hours.

Confirm all code/infrastructure run in our Twilio/GHL/cloud and code lands in our repo.

End your proposal with this exact line:
I have read this spec end-to-end and did not use a template.

Nice-to-haves

Experience with bank statement parsing (negative days / ADB).

Prior MCA, lending, insurance, or regulated calling experience.

Familiar with answer rate rehab and branded calling.

Ground Rules

We are not running a paid pilot at this time. We will select based on specificity and live artifacts.

Template/AI-sounding replies or missing any of the application steps above will be archived.
